com.igormaznitsa.prol.utils
Class Utils

java.lang.Object
  com.igormaznitsa.prol.utils.Utils

public final class Utils
extends java.lang.Object

It is an auxulary class which contains different useful functions for work with the Prol engine

Author:
Igor Maznitsa (igor.maznitsa@igormaznitsa.com)

Method Detail

fillTableWithVars

public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Var> fillTableWithVars(Term term)
Get a hashmap filled by variables found in a term, the variables can be accessed by their string names

Parameters:
term - the term which variables should be returned, must not be null
Returns:
a HashMap object contains variables from the term accessibled by their String names

getNumberFromElement

public static java.lang.Number getNumberFromElement(Term term)
Return a Number object from a Term if it is possible.

Parameters:
term - the term which should be converted into a number
Returns:
a Number object if it is possible
Throws:
com.igormaznitsa.prol.exceptions.ProlInstantiationErrorExceptionit - it will be thrown if the term is a noninstantiated variable.
ProlTypeErrorException - it will be thrown if the term is not a numeric term

getStringFromElement

public static java.lang.String getStringFromElement(Term term)
Convert the term into a String. If the term is not instantiated the ProlCriticalError will be thrown.

Parameters:
term - the term to be converted into String.
Returns:
the term text representation as a String (the same value which will be written by write/1 for the term)
Throws:
com.igormaznitsa.prol.exceptions.ProlInstantiationErrorExceptionit - it will be thrown if the term is a non instantiaded variable

getRootThrowable

public static java.lang.Throwable getRootThrowable(java.lang.Throwable ex)
Find the root throwable object in an excepotion

Parameters:
ex - a trhowable object to find the root, must not be null
Returns:
a throwable object which is the root for the cause chain of the exception or the same exception if there is not any cause

getTermFromElement

public static Term getTermFromElement(Term element)
If the term is a instantiated variable thane the function will return the variable value else the same term

Parameters:
element - the term which shold be processed, must not be null
Returns:
the value of a variable if the term is an instantiated variable else the same term

getListAsAtom

public static Term getListAsAtom(ProlContext context,
                                 TermList list)
Encode a prolog list into a prolog structure where all elements of the list will be the elements of the structure. The first element of the list will be the functor.

Parameters:
context - a prol context which will be used during the operation to find predicate processors, must not be null.
list - the list to be converted into a prolog structure, must not be null
Returns:
if the list is the null list, the term will be returned, else a prolog structure contains the first list element as the functor and other list elements as elements of the structure.

arrayToList

public static TermList arrayToList(Term[] array)
Convert a term array into a term list

Parameters:
array - an array to be converted
Returns:
if an array is null or has zero length then NULLLIST will be returned else a TermList contains all elements of the array

listToArray

public static Term[] listToArray(TermList list)
Convert a term list into a term array

Parameters:
list - the list to be converted into an array, must not be null
Returns:
a term array contains all elements from the list, if the list is a NULLLIST then zero length array will be returned

unrollTermIntoList

public static TermList unrollTermIntoList(Term element)
Unroll a term into a term list.

Parameters:
element - a term to be unrolled into a term list, must not be null
Returns:
a term list contains elements form the source term

arrangeVariablesInsideTerms

public static void arrangeVariablesInsideTerms(Term termOne,
                                               Term termTwo)
Arrange variables between two terms (to make named variable links to the same objects in both terms)

Parameters:
termOne - the first term, must not be null
termTwo - the second term, must not be null

printPredicatesForLibrary

public static void printPredicatesForLibrary(java.io.PrintStream out,
                                             java.lang.Class libraryClass)
Out all information about found predicates in a prol library into a PrintOut

Parameters:
out - a PrintStream to output the text information, must not be null
libraryClass - a library class which will be processed to find all predicate definitions inside, must not be null
See Also:
ProlAbstractLibrary

                          int number)
Out a number spaces into a print stream

Parameters:
out - the print stream for the output, must not be null
number - the number of space chars to be out into the stream

Out a term as a tree into the System.out

Parameters:
term - the term to be shown as a tree, must not be null

public static void printTree(java.io.PrintStream out,
                             int spaces,
                             Term term)
Out a term as a tree into a PrintStream

Parameters:
out - the output stream which will be used for the output, must not be null
spaces - the output position offset from the left side
term - the term to be out, must not be null

Out a term state into the System.out

Parameters:

                                  Term term)
Out a term state into a PrintStream

Parameters:

term - a term to be out into the stream

encodeTextSourceLike

public static java.lang.String encodeTextSourceLike(java.lang.String string)
Encode text string to be possible use it in a prolog source file

Parameters:
string - a string to be processed, must not be null
Returns:
the result of the processing as a String

consultFromURLConnection

public static void consultFromURLConnection(java.lang.String url,
                                            ProlContext context)
                                     throws java.io.IOException,
                                            java.lang.InterruptedException
The function allows to make a consultation from a resource addresed by its URL. You can use "this://[resource_path]" to get access to the resource through ContextClassLoader.getResourceAsStrean()

Parameters:
url - the url of a resource which will be used for the consultation, must not be null
context - the context which will be as the owner for the information, must not be null
Throws:
java.io.IOException - it will be thrown if the information can't be read from the source
java.lang.InterruptedException - it will be thrown if the thread has been interrupted

extractPredicateSignatureFromStructure

public static java.lang.String extractPredicateSignatureFromStructure(Term term)
Allows to decode a structure contains a term signature and usually represented as predicate_name/arity (as an example test/2)

Parameters:
term - a predicate which is either a structure or a variable instantiated by a structure, must not be null
Returns:
decoded predicate signature as a String or null if it is impossible to extract a signature from the structure

normalizeSignature

public static java.lang.String normalizeSignature(java.lang.String signature)
Check that the signature has normal view (name/arity) and if not ('name'/arity), then correct it

Parameters:
signature - a signature to be checked and corrected, must not be null
Returns:
corrected signature as a String or null if the argument is not a signature

findVarInsideTerm

public static Var findVarInsideTerm(Term term,
                                    java.lang.String name)
Allows to get a Var contained inside a Term

Parameters:
term - the term which will be used for search, must not be null
name - the variable name, must not be null
Returns:
a Var object for the name or null if it is not found

validateSignature

public static java.lang.String validateSignature(java.lang.String signature)
